title: Riot thank you for Rakan, seriously
body:
Amidst all the hate riot is getting. I just want to say thank you for making Rakan. Not only did me and my Duo have countless amount of hours of fun ( we got m7 in 2-3 days)  but i was the first person to reach 1 million points on him. Grinding on him actually gave me plans for a day rather than just waking up and working. 

Before i never played supports, the passive or tanky nature didnt appeal to me, i liked someone fast, nimble and mobile really peaked my interest, and when i first played him i loved it.  We rushed from college that day and insta-bought the champs and their skins .
I only played Edgy champions like Zed, Talon, Jhin, Varus and Warwick but Rakans loud and donkey like (shrek) personality still resonated with me. 

Although i have some beef with the soul patch he has :( , the art, voice acting, lore and gameplay all blend together perfectly to make a perfect champion. 

Again, Thanks Riot {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Personal gripes:

-AP mages got new items but none of them actually addressed their needs(Bruiser AP and AS AP left in the dust + Mandatory Void problem)
-some Rune keystones are crimes against humanity (Electro,Aery,Grasp) and others are just borderline trolling (Lethal Temp still kinda bad. Dark HArvest is MEEM. Inspiration keystones are OMEGALUL with only the secondary parts being worthwhile for cheating out free gold). Resolve tree still feels pretty strong esp boneplate.
-where is my teambuilder? When is teambuilder coming back (and no dont recommend draft cuz its not the same)
-Fighter items got iceboxed instead of just adding it to the stew while it was still going
-I still kinda think the rate of VGU change is a bit slow? by late 2019 I feel like the entire roster should be "fixed" but thats not gonna happen at the ol 1 VGU every 2-3 months rate consider just how many champions we have from Season 1 and 2.
-I still feel like IP grinding is slower than before. I HATE that level up Blue Ess is randomized and you can get the short end of the stick occasionally. I also feel like the whole disenchant for ess system is silly because it makes so you can NEVER mastery system certain champs because theyre simply worth way too much
-so many gemstone related stuff getting added but the rate of Gemstones seems non-existent meaning you just gotta wait for gemstone bundles
-RGM got removed for what is basically competitive Flex with rewards. I really wanna play ascension/Bloodmoon again :s. Even that meh PROJECT game mode I would give another whirl just for those cool slow-mo kill animations.
-really random but I dont think the new Icons shoulda been 5k blue ess each. thats highway robbery practically cmon bro
-still no announcer packs even though youve put like over 5 of em into the game indirectly about now (Star Guardian,Phreak/Kobe,Pyke,Gangplank,Darkstar Thresh ect) and you've received overwhelming "i want this" feedback
-I still kinda wish you did a overhaul to the summoner spell system now that Runes are taken care of. It would be cool to see like specialized spells (Ignite that causes GWounds vs Ignite that causes damage amp vs Ignite that heals YOU for the damage dealt ect)
-another random complain but I wish more skins had VO. Idk how every other  game out there has ZERO problems finding VA's for thier game (like how every skin SMITE releases has a new VA ) but this is out of the realm of riots reach for some reason.

Crit marksmen WOULD be fine, if riot would properly rebalance towers and baron. Instead, the games end at 20 minutes. Crit marksmen are where they beling, useless until three items, and gods afterwards. Nothing is wrong with Crit ADs, Riot just has this obsession with ending the game too early, and its killing everything by stripping away champion distinctions, and the difference between early mid and late game

Riot wants quicker games because faster games are easier to fit into peoples schedule.

nobody wants to be stuck in a game for a literal hour or 40 minutes.

quick 20 minute games allow so many more people to fit league into their life.
Faster games make the balance really wonky (how do you curve early-mid and lategame champs around 20 minutes when laning phase is like half of that lol) but in the bigger picture faster games are actually a good thing imo.

Right, so I get to enjoy a shitty frustrating game, which adheres to no consistency and is a coin flip because no matter how well my team does, a single mistake can undo it all. My team can outperform twenty times, but only one mistake is enough to cost us baron, and thats GG. 

Its less skill based, there are more OP champions, the OP champions are unfun to play against in addition to being OP. The result of twenty minute games is that the games are unfun and miserable. The only parts of the game that are ever fun, is when all ten people say "Screw the meta, I want to play X". Essentially, playing to win is the least fun way to play the game, which is quite idiotic for a game whos main objective is "Win"
Preach! ughh there should never be a reason for a game to drag out that long imo

A lot of players like the crit changes and think they were a step in the right direction.  I just want to make sure you're seeing both sides of the feedback in case you get to talk with the balance/gameplay devs.  

Practically everyone hates the pace of the game right now though.  Games are too short, snowbally, and full of 100-0s within <2 seconds.  

Tanks feel like armor is almost pointless while mages think magic resistance is overpowered.  Full AD teams have too easy of a time shredding armor stacking tanks while AP champions feel like they have no DPS options to break through the defenses of anyone who builds just {{item:3156}} + {{item:3071}} or even one MR tank item {{item:3065}} or {{item:3194}} .

Marksmen mains want crit buffed so that they have zero competition for the bot lane carry position, but everyone else is happy with the slight increase in diversity we have now and marksmen are still being played more than any other class.  The community (Marksmen mains vs everyone else) is split on that issue.  A lot of people feel like Riot is backpedaling against good progress and is showing too much marksman favoritism while marksmen mains hold the game balance hostage because they want to remain the best carry role in the game.  The compromise that will make the most people happy is to reduce the 1-shot damage output being thrown around so that marksmen don't die in >1 second but also add more APC item options and support items to synergize with bot APCs until we get real bot lane carry diversity.

Also, the community pretty much unanimously disliked the scuttle changes.  I've seen no positive feedback about it.  I have personally gotten used to it, but it has killed weak junglers.  Tank junglers need buffs.  Balance is out of whack right now but some of us are trying to be patient.

Also, the event missions have been broken this weekend and we lost our event progress.  That's been a slight annoyance but I don't hold it against Riot.  Technical difficulties are sure to happen, and I bet someone had to come in on the weekend to fix it, so I know it sucks for you guys too.

People seem to think the insult topics are increasing in quantity even though they really havnt, or if they have, not by a noticeable amount.

PS I have loved and drawn every new Female champ since Camille!  Keep up the good work!

Also, you're #3 Rakan MP-wise worldwide - damn, that's impressive.  I'm not quite on the global list yet, but I am #4 NA.  Sadly we aren't in the same region or I'd say I hope to run into you in games, but still, have fun playing Rakan.
+1 for Rakanye

Agreed, Rakan is also one of my favorite supports. I find his personally really likeable, and his playstyle as as a hypermobile support is something I find absolutely brilliant. While I don't think Riot should copy him outright on another champion, I think he sets an example for the vast array of playstyles supports could potentially have. Supporting doesn't have to always mean standing back and healing, or soaking up damage, it can also be about moving quickly around the battlefield to apply key utility and crowd control. I think he's a very well-done champion overall, and I hope to see more champions as fresh as him in the future.
